alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 6:28PM MST until June 26 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 623 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that rainfall has diminished over the warned area, southeast Yavapai County from Black Canyon City northeastward. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon, and flash flooding is likely ongoing on several washes in this area. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black Canyon City and Horseshoe Reservoir. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Sycamore Creek, Dry Creek, Tangle Creek, Agua Fria River, Verde River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
